• We are seeking an experienced AI Solutions Architect Manager to lead the design, development, and implementation of cutting-edge AI solutions leveraging GPU-accelerated infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both software (AI/ML frameworks) and hardware (GPU/data center infrastructure), with the ability to manage cross-functional teams and deliver scalable AI systems. This role requires a deep understanding of AI technologies, cloud/edge computing, and data center operations, as well as excellent leadership and communication skills.

Responsibilities:

1. Solution Design and Architecture:

  • Lead the design and architecture of end-to-end AI solutions, ensuring they are scalable, efficient, and aligned with business goals.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
  • Evaluate and select appropriate AI frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and GPU hardware (e.g., NVIDIA, AMD) for specific use cases.
  • Design solutions that integrate AI models with existing data center infrastructure, cloud platforms, and edge computing environments.

2. Technical Leadership:

  • Manage a team of AI engineers, data scientists, and infrastructure specialists to deliver AI projects on time and within budget.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning.
  • Oversee the optimization of AI models for GPU-accelerated computing, ensuring maximum performance and efficiency.

3. Infrastructure and Deployment:

  • Work closely with data center and network engineering teams to ensure seamless deployment of AI solutions.
  • Oversee the setup and management of GPU clusters, ensuring optimal utilization and performance.
  • Ensure compliance with data center standards, including power, cooling, and network requirements.

4. Stakeholder Collaboration:

  • Act as the primary technical point of contact for clients, partners, and internal stakeholders.
  • Present technical solutions to non-technical audiences, explaining complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
  • Collaborate with business development teams to identify new opportunities for AI-driven solutions.

5. Innovation and Research:

  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, GPU computing, and data center technologies.
  • Identify and evaluate emerging tools and frameworks that can enhance the organization's AI capabilities.
  • Drive innovation by proposing and implementing new AI solutions that address business challenges.

Qualifications:

  1. Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
  2. Minimum of 3-6 years of experience in AI/ML, with at least 3-5 years in a leadership or managerial role
  3. Proven experience in designing and deploying AI solutions using GPU-accelerated infrastructure.
  4. Strong understanding of AI frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and GPU programming (e.g., CUDA).
  5. Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and edge computing environments.
  6. Familiarity with data center operations, including networking, power, and cooling systems.

Job Summary:

As a Cybersecurity Engineer, you will be responsible for configuring and maintaining security systems, developing and implementing security measures, and performing regular security audits. Your expertise will be vital in implementing and improving security systems, cyber incident detection and response, and developing effective metrics to measure security performance.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Monitor operations and infrastructure by reviewing dashboards, alerts, and logs daily to maintain digital security footprint.
  • Configure and maintain security and related platforms and infrastructure, including Microsoft 365, AWS, Azure, Firewalls, Endpoint and Email Security.
  • Develop, update, improve and implement security measures and controls, incident response, disaster recovery, data loss, and business continuity plans.
  • Secure digital files and information systems.
  • Perform regular internal and external security audits, vulnerability assessments, and penetration testing.
  • Develop effective and measurable metrics (KRI, KPI, KCI).
  • Build and lead incident monitoring and response.
  • Monitor and report compliance against policies and appropriate standards.
  • Recommend and implement security improvements and controls.
  • Maintain security procedures and policies.
  • Develop, promote, and improve security awareness.
  • Support the implementation of the cybersecurity strategy.
  • Support client security audits.
  • Ensure security is considered and embedded in every aspect of the organization.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or Information Technology.
  • Minimum 5 years of international work experience as a Cybersecurity engineer or similar role including Cyber incident response.
  • Microsoft Certified: Security Operations Analyst Associate, Identity and Access Administrator Associate, Information Protection and Compliance Administrator Associate.
  • Fluent in English with strong communication skills.
  • Proven ability to effectively communicate with and present to senior stakeholders.
  • Strong work ethic and integrity: Dependable, accurate, and thorough, with a proactive and responsive approach.
  • Growth-oriented mindset: Curious, adaptable, and passionate about cybersecurity, always seeking improvement opportunities.

Preferred:

  • Certifications in Infosec (e.g. CISM, CISSP, etc), ISO 27001 (Certified Auditor or Lead Implementor), Pentesting (e.g. CEH, GPEN, OSCP, etc), Cloud Security (CCSK, Cloud+, GCSA, or CCSP).
  • Other relevant certifications: ITIL, PMP, Prince 2, TOGAF, Agile, or DEVOPS.
